title.narrative: STRENGTHEN PARTNERS CAPACITY (GOV. & CSOS) FOR CHILD FRIENDLY EQUITABLE EDUCATION

description.narrative: By 2022, education officers at national and sub-national levels have increased capacity to plan, budget, implement and monitor child friendly education in elementary and primary schools including education for out of school children in selected provinces., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, school aged girls and boy, especially the most marginalized, successfully complete pre-primary and primary education.

sector.narrative: Education analyses including OOSCI, Education Sector Analyses, etc.

Ending violence against women and girls
Provision of (formal and non-formal) early-learning / pre-primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
Provision of (formal and non-formal) primary education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - early learning / pre-primary policy, leadership, and budget
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2022, education officers at national and sub-national levels have increased capacity to plan, budget, implement and monitor child friendly education in elementary and primary schools including education for out of school children in selected provinces.

description.narrative:
UNICEF supported the Government in establishing an ECD Alliance and organizing a national ECD symposium to agree on a road map to move ECD forward in PNG. UNICEF also supported the Government in securing a Global Partnership for Education grant of $7.4 million. In addition, UNICEF supported the finalization of the inclusive education policy mainstreaming children with disabilities in formal education and the national literacy policy with alternative basic education curriculum framework to mainstream formal education and skills development for out of school children. The behaviour management policy which was revised in 2019 now addresses gender-based violence in schools.
| Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of national and subnational education officers (selected provinces) trained in monitoring and evaluation skills through the National School Standards Framework and reporting improved capacity.

System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
